articles.content:
Door open for Japan's corrupt broadcasting programs
    Pyongyang, February 24 (KCNA) -- The South Korean authorities have decided to fling the door open for Japan's corrupt radio broadcasting, a Seoul-based radio said.    According to it, all radios, TV and other relevant units of South Korea are allowed to deal with films, news items and entertainment of Japan on a large scale.

Russian ambassador gives party
   Pyongyang, February 24 (KCNA) -- Valery Denisov, Russian  ambassador to Korea, gave a party  at the Taedonggang Club for the Diplomatic Corps on February 23 on the occasion of the "Day of Fatherland Defenders."      Invited there were lieutenant general Pak Sung Won and other officers of the Korean People's Army and foreign military attaches here.      Military attach Vladimir Dombrovsky and other officials of the Russian embassy were on hand.   Speeches were made.

articles.content:
Annual meeting of Korea-Cuba Solidarity Committee
   Pyongyang, February 24 (KCNA) -- An annual meeting of the Korea-Cuba Solidarity Committee was held here on Tuesday.      The meeting summed up last year's activities of the Committee for Supporting the Cuban people in the struggle to firmly defend socialism, decisively smashing the anti-Cuba blockade of the U.S., and strengthening friendship and solidarity with them and discussed action program for this year.     Present at the meeting were Choe Ki Ryong, Minister of Education and chairman of the committee, and other officials concerned.      On hand were also Nirsia Castro Guevara, charge d'affaires ad interim, and officials of the Cuban embassy here.

articles.content:
Kim Jong Il sends many books to Grand People's Study House
   Pyongyang, February 24 (KCNA) - General Secretary Kim Jong Il sent many books and video tapes on science and technology to the Grand People's Study House.   He sent some 3,900 books of 970 odd kinds on different domains on 11 occasions and 73 video tapes on 5 occasions to the house this year alone.   Among them are books on basic and social sciences and on science and technologies including techniques of computer use, laser and production of solar batteries.   Video tapes include "Data on ultra-modern construction" and "How to raise ostrich."

articles.title: Kim Jong Il praised by Russian
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il receives message from Chongryon
   Pyongyang, February 24 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il received a message of thanks on Monday from the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan (Chongryon) Central Standing Committee for the Educational Aid Fund and Stipend.   The message noted Chongryon was very happy and moved to receive the educational aid fund and stipend of 114,030,000 yen General Secretary sent again for the democratic national education of Chongryon.   
The message said:   Indeed, you are the tender-hearted father of Korean residents in Japan including school youth and children, who values and leads Chongryon and them.
We renew our firm resolution to remain loyal to your idea and leadership in step with the dynamic advance of the people in the homeland.   We will further strengthen and develop Chongryon into an overseas compatriots' organization which is faithful to you and which throws in its lot with the socialist homeland in any storms.   We will strictly maintain the Juche character and national character in school education so as to train the Korean school youth and children in Japan to be able men for the nation and true Koreans who are boundlessly faithful to you.

articles.title: S. Korean Medical Insurance Trade Union on strike
DPRK abounds in granite
articles.content:
S. Korean Medical Insurance Trade Union on strike
   Pyongyang, February 24 (KCNA) -- The "National Workshop Medical Insurance Trade Union" of South Korea went on an overall strike on Tuesday demanding a repeal of the authorities' measure of medical insurance merger and so on, a Seoul-based radio said.   Over 3,000 unionists of its 100 branches participated in the strike.   The trade union had been on partial strikes demanding a repeal of the "Law on Protecting People's Hhealth" since last Thursday.
